title: Tech Lead - Platform Engineering
description:
**About Brite**


Founded in 2019, Brite Payments is a leading open banking-powered account-to-account (A2A) payment provider of instant payments, payouts, and other financial services in Europe. Brite is committed to creating fast, secure, and transparent payment solutions that reduce risk for businesses and provide consumers with the best possible payment experience.


At the heart of Brite is our proprietary instant payments network, Brite IPN, which enables real-time, 24/7 transaction processing with no delays, sign-ups, or card details required. Today, Brite connects with over 3,800 banks in 27 European markets and is committed to delivering cutting-edge, next-generation payment solutions that meet the market’s evolving needs.


Headquartered in Stockholm, Brite has offices in London and Malaga and now numbers over 150 colleagues.


Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!

 **About the role**


At Brite Payments, we're seeking an **experienced leader** to drive our Platform Engineering team. In this role, you’ll lead the team in providing a platform for our engineering teams to build their products upon, and that the team operates effectively as a support and enabling function in line with Team Topologies.

 **What you will do**

  

As a Tech Lead for Platform Engineering, you will:

* **Lead the Platform Engineering Team** in its daily work in agile methodologies, solution discovery, technical implementations, deliveries, knowledge-sharing, supporting engineers, and scaling tools & practices for high adoption-rate within the department through focusing on improving the developer experience.
* **Collaborate with Engineering Teams** and meet their individual needs in order to enable their self-sufficiency in the full lifecycle of software development.
* **Define Platform Strategy** by contributing to roadmaps and architectures that balance immediate needs with long-term scalability and sustainability.
* **Drive Platform Automation** by improving cloud infrastructure, deployment pipelines, monitoring, and security, with a focus on minimizing operational overhead.
* **Facilitate Best Practices in GCP**, ensuring the team leverages tools and methodologies that maximize scalability, reliability, and security.
* **Foster a Culture of Continuous Improvement** by supporting teams in adopting DevOps and SRE methodologies to streamline operations and boost delivery speed.
* **Mentor and Coach Team Members** to foster technical growth, to maintain a supportive & collaborative engineering culture, to encourage leadership, and distribute responsibilities effectively. As a Tech Lead, you will empower team members to take on ownership of key initiatives, nurture a bottom-up approach to share the load and build cross-functional capability within your team of complementary skills and personalities.

**Required Skills**

* **Proven Leadership Experience**: Demonstrated success leading both technical & cultural work in building enabling platforms and support systems for engineering teams.
* **You have your competence in either cloud operations, or devops:** You either come from a strong cloud operations background, or you have extensive experience from product development and modern ways of working.
* **Infrastructure as Code**: Proficiency with tools such as Terraform and automation frameworks for deployment and configuration management.
* **Containerization & Orchestration**: Hands-on experience with Docker and orchestration tools like Google Cloud Run, AWS Fargate/ECS, or similar.
* **Monitoring & Logging**: Familiarity with monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Stackdriver, Datadog) to ensure platform reliability and performance.
* **CI/CD Proficiency**: Excellent knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Bitbucket Pipelines, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI.
* **Operational Excellence**: Experience applying SRE principles, with a focus on uptime, scalability, and continuous improvement.
* **Communication Skills**: Strong communicator, with the ability to work effectively across teams to foster alignment and collaboration.

**Preferred Skills**

* **GCP Cost Management**: Experience with budgeting and optimizing cloud expenditures.
* **Database Management**: Knowledge of database management on GCP, including performance optimization, scalability, and security.
* **Incident Management**: Familiarity with incident management processes and frameworks.
* **Automation Scripting**: Proficiency in programming/scripting languages such as Python.
* **Microservices Architecture**: Strong understanding of designing and scaling microservices in a cloud environment.


Join Brite Payments and help us empower our engineering teams to build high-quality platforms that fuel our next phase of growth. With your leadership, we’ll set the foundation for an exceptional future!

 **What we offer**

* An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where you can be yourself.
* A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment, with the chance to join one of Europe’s hottest fintechs and learn from industry leaders.
* The opportunity to make an impact from day one in an organisation that values quick decision-making, teamwork, and results over titles.
* Exposure to a variety of verticals and use cases for our payments products, working with some of the fastest-growing businesses in Europe.
* An annual well-being and professional development allowance to invest in your personal growth.
* A team of fun, skilled professionals who together raised the largest Series A ($60m) in Europe last year – join colleagues who are committed to making a lasting impact.

Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**About Brite**


Founded in 2019, Brite Payments is a leading open banking-powered account-to-account (A2A) payment provider of instant payments, payouts, and other financial services in Europe. Brite is committed to creating fast, secure, and transparent payment solutions that reduce risk for businesses and provide consumers with the best possible payment experience.


At the heart of Brite is our proprietary instant payments network, Brite IPN, which enables real-time, 24/7 transaction processing with no delays, sign-ups, or card details required. Today, Brite connects with over 3,800 banks in 27 European markets and is committed to delivering cutting-edge, next-generation payment solutions that meet the market’s evolving needs.


Headquartered in Stockholm, Brite has offices in London and Malaga and now numbers over 150 colleagues.


Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!

 **About the role**


At Brite Payments, we are looking for an experienced **Platform Engineer** to join our Platform Engineering team. In this role, you will focus on improving our platform infrastructure and work closely with various engineering teams to help them overcome challenges and adopt best practices. This position combines both platform engineering and an enabling role, ensuring operational excellence while enhancing developer experience.


You will be part of our growing Platform Engineering team, which acts as both a platform team (building foundational infrastructure) and an enabling team (supporting engineering teams to improve operational efficiency). Your focus will be slightly more on the enabling side, helping engineering teams to deliver high-quality solutions faster and more reliably.

**What you will do**

* **Collaborate with engineering teams** to troubleshoot, optimize, and enhance their infrastructure and deployment processes, ensuring scalability, security, and performance.
* **Improve platform tooling and automation** to streamline the development lifecycle, reduce operational bottlenecks, and enable faster, more reliable deployments.
* **Implement and promote DevOps best practices** across teams, helping developers optimize CI/CD pipelines and adopt Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* **Ensure reliability and uptime** by developing and maintaining effective monitoring, alerting, and incident response practices.
* **Drive cloud infrastructure optimization** within Google Cloud Platform (GCP), helping teams make the best use of GCP services while controlling costs and improving efficiency.
* **Enable teams with automation solutions**, whether through building self-service tools, improving deployment workflows, or offering guidance on GCP resources and operational processes.
* **Support a culture of continuous improvement** by adopting and promoting Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) practices, ensuring stability and scalability across systems.

 **Required skills:**

* Experience with at least one of the big cloud providers, but preferably **GCP**.
* Proficiency in **DevOps practices**, including CI/CD pipeline management, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with tools like Terraform, and cloud infrastructure automation.
* Experience working with **monitoring and logging tools** such as Prometheus, Grafana, Stackdriver, or Datadog to ensure system health and performance.
* Experience of **containerization** and orchestration tools.
* Expertise in **troubleshooting and performance optimization**, helping engineering teams resolve issues efficiently and improve the overall developer experience.


Experience with **incident management** processes and a proactive approach to preventing downtime and service interruptions.

**Preferred skills:**

* Experience in **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)**, preferably hands-on use of services like AppEngine, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Pub/Sub, and BigQuery.
* Experience optimizing **cloud resource usage and costs** on GCP, with a focus on cost control and efficient infrastructure scaling.
* Familiarity with **microservices architecture** and how to build, manage, and scale services in a cloud-native environment.
* Proficiency in **automation scripting** using languages like Python, Bash, or similar to create reusable, scalable solutions.
* A solid understanding of **SRE principles** and experience applying them to achieve operational excellence.


With your contributions at Brite Payments, you will continue to empower our engineering teams and deliver high-quality platforms, setting the foundation for our next phase of growth. Join us and be part of building something exceptional!

 **What we offer**

* An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where you can be yourself.
* A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment, with the chance to join one of Europe’s hottest fintechs and learn from industry leaders.
* The opportunity to make an impact from day one in an organisation that values quick decision-making, teamwork, and results over titles.
* Exposure to a variety of verticals and use cases for our payments products, working with some of the fastest-growing businesses in Europe.
* An annual well-being and professional development allowance to invest in your personal growth.
* A team of fun, skilled professionals who together raised the largest Series A ($60m) in Europe last year – join colleagues who are committed to making a lasting impact.

Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.

title: Observability Engineer (Logging & Monitoring)
description:
#### **Observability Engineer till Ving**

 **Vill du vara med och bidra till att Ving fortsätter leverera de bästa veckorna på året?**


Vi på Ving söker nu en engagerad och driven **Observability Engineer** som vill vara med och skapa framtidens molnlösningar! Hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i vår tekniska utveckling och bidra till att säkerställa att våra system fungerar sömlöst, så att vi kan fortsätta leverera fantastiska semesterupplevelser till våra gäster. Vår mission är att vara *“the leading holiday & experience company dedicated to well-being”*, och vi jobbar varje dag för att vår vision *“Enriching life”* ska genomsyra allt vi gör.

 **Rollen som Observability Engineer**


I denna roll kommer du att vara en del av vårt **Azure Core Team**, där du arbetar med att driva och implementera observability-lösningar för våra plattformar. Du kommer att ha ett stort ansvar för att utveckla strategier för loggning, monitorering och automatisering i våra Azure-miljöer. Din roll är viktig för att vi ska kunna identifiera potentiella problem i tid, säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och förhindra driftstörningar.

**Vad kommer du att göra hos oss?**

* Driva och implementera observability-lösningar för våra Azure-miljöer.
* Utveckla och optimera strategier för loggning och monitorering.
* Implementera Infrastructure as Code (IaC) för observabilitykonfigurationer.
* Använda verktyg som **Dynatrace**, **Azure Monitor**, **Log Analytics** och**Kusto Query Language (KQL).**
Stötta molnmigrationer och hybridlösningar med observability-principer.  
* 

**Vi ser att du uppfyller följande punkter:**

* Goda kunskaper i svenska ochengelska.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med observability och monitoreringslösningar inom Azure.
* God förståelse för **Dynatrace**, **Azure Monitor**, **Log Analytics**, **Application Insights** och **KQL**.
* Kompetens inom **CI/CD** och **DevOps-kultur**.
* Erfarenhet av **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)**-verktyg som **Bicep** eller **ARM Templates**.
* Certifieringar som *Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert* eller liknande är meriterande.  

  

**Vem är du?**  

Du har en passion för teknik och en vilja att vara med och skapa den bästa möjliga plattformen för våra digitala tjänster. Du är proaktiv, analytisk och älskar att hitta lösningar som gör systemen mer robusta och tillförlitliga.

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**

* En dynamisk och utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du får arbeta med den senaste tekniken.
* Möjlighet att påverka och sätta din prägel på våra tekniska lösningar.
* Stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och karriärvägar inom både Ving och **Nordic Leisure Travel Group**.
* En arbetsplats där vi sätter teamet och våra värderingar i första rummet.
* Förmåner som gör att du kan njuta av både arbete och fritid, inklusive generösa reseerbjudanden!  

  

Vi är en arbetsplats med ett stort kunnande och en stark drivkraft att ständigt förbättra vår verksamhet. Som en del av **Nordic Leisure Travel Group** erbjuder vi en spännande och utvecklande miljö med möjlighet till en intern karriär. Vår arbetsglädje och vårt höga engagemang visar sig i vår årliga medarbetarundersökning – och vi är stolta över att vara en arbetsplats där du kan växa och utvecklas.

**Ansök idag och bli en del av Ving-familjen!**


Vill du vara med på vår resa och hjälpa oss skapa minnesvärda upplevelser för våra gäster? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten eller vår verksamhet.


Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team!

 **Övrigt**


Välkommen med din ansökan! Urval sker löpande, så vi välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjligt.


I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. När du har skickat in din ansökan och går vidare i processen kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig med mer information. Är du nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos Alva Labs.

**Vill du veta mer om tjänsten kontakta Carlos Cederfeldt (carlos.cederfeldt@nltg.com).**

title: Business Analyst with ﻿AI literacy
description:
### **Role Overview**


As a Business Analyst with AI literacy, you’ll play a key role in building and fostering a thriving data and AI community within the organization. You will work cross-functionally to design training and upskilling programs for both technical and non-technical teams. Your focus will be on creating a culture of data literacy and supporting the adoption of data-driven insights across the organization. You’ll be a bridge between technical experts and end users, ensuring that the community grows, learns, and thrives.

 **Key Responsibilities**  

You'll develop training programs for data analysts, ensuring alignment with next-gen platforms. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create training materials, host forums, and lead workshops to support the company’s data-driven goals.You'll also build and nurture a strong data community, organizing events like hackathons and webinars to foster collaboration and knowledge sharing. Additionally, you'll advocate for data literacy across the organization and track KPIs to measure community engagement and training success.

 **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in a data-related role, community management, or program management with a focus on data, AI, or technology.
* Strong project management skills and ability to work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders.
* Experience planning and executing community events, both online and offline.
* Solid understanding of AI and data trends.
* Data-driven with the ability to analyze and interpret both quantitative and qualitative data.
* Highly organized and detail-oriented, with a strategic mindset.

**Bonus skills**

* Experience in building and driving AI or data communities.
* Background in data analytics, with knowledge of tools such as Python, R, SQL, and Google Cloud Platform.


This is an exciting opportunity to drive the data and AI transformation within a global organization. If you are passionate about community-building, data literacy, and fostering a culture of learning, we’d love to hear from you!

**Percentage of remote work allowed:** 50%  

**Period from:** 2024-11-25  

**Period to:** 2025-12-31  

**Location:** Stockholm

title: Partner & Alliance Manager Nordics
description:
*Benify is a globally recognized HR tech company dedicated to delivering top-notch benefits through its rewards platform. With an internationally diverse team of 500+ Benifyers across 6 countries, we are successfully collaborating with around 1500 customers and meeting the needs of close to two million users worldwide* *. Our mission is all about empowering individuals, supporting them to realize their full potential while promoting an engaging and sustainable work atmosphere where everyone is included and valued - "Because People Matter"* *.*  

  

Are you a dynamic professional with a proven track record in partner sales and an interest in understanding customers' needs? Then we have an exciting opportunity for a qualified individual to focus on our Nordic market as an Partner & Alliance Manager at our Stockholm HQ Office. You will report to our Head of Enterprise Sales Nordics.  

  

As our Partner & Alliance Manager for the Nordics, you will be responsible for building and managing strategic partnerships that drive growth and expand our market presence. This role involves identifying new opportunities, managing partner relationships, and collaborating closely with Benify’s sales and product teams to enhance our go-to-market strategies. You will be instrumental in increasing Benify’s reach in the Nordics by developing strong relationships and effective sales channels, working directly with Nordic leadership to achieve our strategic objectives.


Here is your chance to become part of our innovative and dynamic team that continues to grow!  

  

**In this role you will:**

* Identify and onboard new channel partners to expand Benify’s reach, ensuring smooth integration and success.


* Manage the full sales cycle from prospecting to contract setup, developing go-to-market strategies aligned with Benify’s goals.


* Collaborate closely with the sales team to capitalize on partnership-driven opportunities and enhance sales performance.


* Build and maintain strong partner relationships, providing ongoing support, contract management, and strategic guidance.


* Stay informed on industry trends to advise partners, resolve issues, and drive competitive advantage across the Nordics.


* Leverage regional insights and travel frequently to strengthen partnerships, driving growth in the Nordic market. **Who are You?**

You are a proactive and strategic individual with a passion for partnership development and sales. You have a proven ability to navigate complex negotiations, understand market dynamics, and build relationships that drive long-term success. You arecurious and embrace creative thinking, employ multi-channel communication, and use data-driven strategies to think innovatively. Your strong problem-solving mindset, coupled with a results-oriented approach, is key.  

  

**Requirements to succeed in the role**

* Minimum of 5 years in a similar role, ideally within the SaaS industr
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Marketing, or a related field
* Strong skills in negotiation, relationship-building, and strategic thinking
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
* Familiarity with IT and Cloud solutions and experience in go-to-market strategies with partners is highly beneficial

Fluency in both Swedish/Danish and English  
* 

**Perks of being a Benifyer**

* Generous wellness allowance or health budget ‍️
* 30 days vacation
* Pension
* Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid work model
* Annual conference and a variety of social events and activities at our offices ️
* Workation - possibility to work abroad within EU .

*If you want to know more about what it's like to work at Benify, please check out our careers page* *here.*

**Practical Information**  

**Start:** The search for the perfect fit starts now!  

**Extent:** Full-time, 100%  

**Location:** Stockholm


We encourage you to apply by submitting your CV and/or LinkedIn profile using the application form below. Constant application screening implies our search may end before the last application date, so hurry!

*We are an equal opportunity employer and are happy to accommodate any reasonable adjustments necessary to help you during the interview process.*

title: Business Development Manager Virtual Data Room
description:
**About Admincontrol**
----------------------


In Admincontrol we believe that our future depends on the quality of decisions, and we deliver digital solutions for efficient and secure management of business-critical information for e.g. board of directors, management teams, and legal and financial advisors. In the Nordic region, we are the leading player in our industry, and our software is used by 2/3 of listed companies in Norway. Admincontrol is a growing company with operations in five European countries and with great future ambitions.


We are convinced that employee well-being and autonomy are key to great product development, and we are proud to have a very high level of employee satisfaction among our 130 employees.


Admincontrol has since 2017 been owned by Visma, the largest privately-owned software business in Europe.

  

**About the position**
----------------------


If you are passionate about sales, customer satisfaction, and can identify yourself with our values smart, passion and trust, we would love to hear from you.


The Business Development Manager Virtual Data Room (VDR) will focus purely on new sales in the Swedish market. You will be responsible for selling secure virtual data room solutions to businesses in various industries, such as mergers and acquisitions (M&A), real estate, legal, financial services, and more. The ideal candidate will combine a deep understanding of VDR and its use cases with excellent communication and sales skills.


You will identify prospects, manage the sales cycle from lead generation to closing, and build long-term relationships with clients to ensure successful adoption and retention of the Admincontrol VDR platform.

**We can offer**
----------------


* An excellent working environment with friendly, talented and approachable colleagues
* An innovative and market leading organisation with high growth and ambitions
* Generous compensation, along with great insurance and pension benefits
* Attractive premises
* Social events

Competitive terms and conditions  
* 

**Responsibilities and tasks**
------------------------------


Working with the Swedish Country Manager and the Virtual Data Room sales team:

* **Lead Generation & Prospecting**  

Identify and target potential Swedish clients through inbound leads, cold calling, networking, and researching new market opportunities. Utilise CRM tools to manage and track prospects.
* **Sales Presentations & Demos:**  

Conduct product demos and presentations, effectively communicating the features, benefits, and value proposition of the VDR solution. Tailor presentations to meet the specific needs of each client.
* **Consultative Selling:**  

Use a consultative approach to understand client pain points and propose customised VDR solutions that align with their business goals and requirements, such as secure document sharing, collaboration, and compliance needs.
* **Sales Cycle Management:**  

Manage the entire sales process from initial contact through to closing the deal. This includes negotiating contracts, addressing client concerns, and ensuring the deal aligns with the customer’s needs.
* **Client Relationship Building:**  

Develop and maintain strong relationships with both new and existing clients. Act as a trusted advisor to clients, providing ongoing support to ensure satisfaction and long-term retention.
* **Market Intelligence:**  

Stay updated on industry trends, competitor offerings, and potential challenges clients may face. Use this knowledge to position the VDR product effectively and remain competitive in the market.
* **Sales Reporting & Metrics:**  

Track sales activities, progress, and results using CRM tools. Provide regular updates on sales targets, opportunities, and challenges to sales leadership.
* **Collaboration with Teams:**  

Work closely with marketing, customer success, and product teams to ensure a seamless sales experience for the client and to gather insights for improving product offerings.

**About you**
-------------


To be successful in your application for the Business Development Manager Virtual Data Room you should be able to exhibit the following:

* **Sales Experience**:  

Proven track record of success in B2B sales, ideally in the SaaS, technology, or financial services industries. Experience in selling complex solutions, such as virtual data rooms, cloud-based platforms, or secure document management systems, is a plus.
* **Technical Proficiency**:  

A strong understanding of virtual data room technology, document management systems, and secure collaboration tools. Ability to explain technical aspects of the product in a simple, compelling way to non-technical clients.
* **Consultative Selling**:  

Ability to approach sales with a consultative mindset, focusing on understanding the customer’s business needs and proposing tailored solutions.
* **Communication & Presentation Skills**:  

Strong verbal and written communication skills. Comfortable presenting to C-level executives and decision-makers.
* **Negotiation Skills**:  

Proven ability to negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing to close deals while maintaining positive client relationships.
* **CRM & Sales Tools**:  

Experience with CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and other sales tools to manage leads, track activities, and report on progress.
* **Self-Motivated & Goal-Oriented**:  

Highly motivated to meet and exceed sales targets. Able to work independently and as part of a team.
* **Industry Knowledge** (preferred):  

Familiarity with industries that commonly use VDRs, such as M&A, legal, real estate, private equity, and finance, is a significant advantage.


Admincontrol is owned by Visma and is among the most successful companies in the Visma group. Read more on **www.admincontrol.com** Applications in Swedish welcomed.

  

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Aksel Belck-Olsen, Head of International Operations.


Phone +47 9825 5323  

Email: belck-olsen@admincontrol.com

title: Teknisk Infrastrukturspecialist
description:
Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, på Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut.
  
Rollen
  
Vi söker en infrastrukturspecialist med fokus inom cloud, O365 och säkerhet som brinner för att skydda och optimera miljöer oavsett om det är i molnet eller hybrida miljöer. Du kommer du att spela en central roll hos våra kunder i att designa och säkra infrastrukturen och kommer arbeta både tekniskt och strategiskt.
  
  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**  

Implementera och underhålla säkerhetslösningar för Microsoft 365 (Teams, SharePoint, Exchange Online).
  
  

Optimera molnmiljöer som Azure, AWS, och Google Cloud.
  
  

Skydda data och användarkonton genom MFA, IAM och dataskydd i O365.
  
  

Implementera och övervaka säkerhetspolicyer för att hantera incidenter.
  
  

Samarbeta för att hålla säkerheten uppdaterad mot nya hot, inklusive riskbedömningar och revisioner.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

För att passa för rollen behöver du relevant bakgrund inom området men vi tror också har du har några eller flera av följande erfarenheter:
  
  

4+ års erfarenhet med Microsoft 365 och molnplattformar (Azure, AWS, GCP).
  
  

Erfarenhet av O365-säkerhetsverktyg som Microsoft Defender, Conditional Access och Azure AD Identity Protection.
  
  

Stark kunskap inom identitetshantering, multifaktorautentisering och molnsäkerhetsfunktioner.
  
  

Meriterande med certifieringar som Microsoft Security Fundamentals, CCSP eller liknande.
  
  

Svenska i tal och skrift är ett krav
  
  

Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi
  
  

Hos oss får du stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter säger vi.
  
  

Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping.
  
Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
  
  

Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?
  
Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till Linda Swartling på linda.swartling@castra.se eller 0763-285171

title: Demand Generation Manager
description:
**At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.**

We are now looking for a **Demand Generation Manager** to join our scale-up environment. If you're an experienced Demand Generation Manager with over 7 years of experience in marketing, particularly in Enterprise/B2B, and possess strong analytical skills - keep reading!

 **Job Summary:**


As the Demand Generation Manager at Epidemic Sound, you will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing strategies to nurture, educate and generate leads and/or revenue for Epidemic Sound. You will work closely with the global marketing, product and analytical teams to align efforts and technical infrastructure, enabling the measurement and optimization of performance on a global scale.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and execute global multi-channel campaigns with a strong focus on utilizing and maximizing the Marketing Cloud Account Engagement (MCAE/Pardot) platform. (Salesforce marketing tools, email, media, sales engagement materials) to drive leads and sales pipeline
* Lead the development and execution of multi-channel campaigns, including lead nurturing, lead scoring, marketing automations strategies, segmentation, and personalized content delivery, to drive prospect engagement and conversion
* Manage external relationships with 3rd party vendors like Salesforce
* Leverage unique differentiation in positioning and messaging by Ideal Customer Profiles (ICP)
* Assist in B2B content development for targeting consumers throughout the customer lifecycle
* Collaborate with sales to develop and implement ABM programs for high-value accounts, ensuring alignment between marketing and sales efforts
* Lead A/B testing strategies and execution across channels (ABM/CRM, digital, content marketing)
* Effectively manage time and resources to deliver high-impact campaigns within tight deadlines.

 **Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
* Minimum of 7+ years of progressive marketing experience. Experience in Enterprise/B2B Marketing is critical.
* Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with MCAE (or similar CRM systems) is essential.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and execute comprehensive, data-driven marketing strategies that align with business objectives.
* Proficiency in data analysis and the ability to use marketing metrics to optimize campaigns and strategies.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas and concepts to diverse audiences.
* Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously.
* Excellent stakeholder management skills, with a proven ability to build reports and influence key decision-makers.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and **scale-up** environment, adjusting strategies as needed to respond to market changes. Ability to be solutions oriented and take initiative in the gray area.
* A passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends.
  


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**  

We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.  



**Application**  

Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
**About Brite**


Founded in 2019, Brite Payments is a leading open banking-powered account-to-account (A2A) payment provider of instant payments, payouts, and other financial services in Europe. Brite is committed to creating fast, secure, and transparent payment solutions that reduce risk for businesses and provide consumers with the best possible payment experience.


At the heart of Brite is our proprietary instant payments network, Brite IPN, which enables real-time, 24/7 transaction processing with no delays, sign-ups, or card details required. Today, Brite connects with over 3,800 banks in 27 European markets and is committed to delivering cutting-edge, next-generation payment solutions that meet the market’s evolving needs.


Headquartered in Stockholm, Brite has offices in London and Malaga and now numbers over 150 colleagues.


Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!

 **About the role**


At Brite Payments, we’re looking for a seasoned Cloud Platform Engineer with deep expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to be the backbone of GCP competence within our Platform Engineering team. In this role, you will be instrumental in architecting, optimizing, and scaling our cloud infrastructure, ensuring reliability, security, and efficiency across our organization. As a key team member, you’ll focus on enhancing our GCP environment, empowering product teams with the tools, practices, and resources they need to effectively manage their products throughout their lifecycle.


This position emphasizes hands-on work with GCP infrastructure and services. You’ll lead efforts in designing a solid, scalable, and cost-effective platform, setting the standard for GCP best practices and enabling our product teams to operate with efficiency and confidence.

**What You Will Do**

* **Architect and Optimize GCP Infrastructure**: Design, build, and maintain a resilient, scalable, and secure GCP environment that supports Brite Payments’ growth, focusing on cost-effectiveness and reliability.
* **Provide GCP Expertise and Leadership**: Serve as the team’s GCP authority, helping drive effective and innovative use of GCP services, such as AppEngine, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Pub/Sub, BigQuery, and others.
* **Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC)**: Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions using tools like Terraform, enabling efficient resource provisioning, scaling, and management.
* **Establish Monitoring and Reliability Standards**: Create robust monitoring and alerting practices with tools like Stackdriver, Prometheus, or Grafana to ensure system health and rapid incident response.
* **Optimize Cloud Costs and Resource Usage**: Continuously evaluate and apply strategies to enhance resource utilization on GCP, ensuring infrastructure is both cost-effective and efficient.
* **Enable Self-Service and Automation**: Develop self-service tools and automated workflows that empower product teams to manage their own resources independently, enhancing efficiency and reducing dependencies.
* **Champion SRE and Reliability Best Practices**: Promote Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles within the team, fostering a culture of stability, reliability, and proactive system management.
* **Support Deployment and Operational Workflows**: Work to ensure that GCP infrastructure aligns with deployment and operational requirements, providing guidance on CI/CD workflows, automation, and cloud-native development practices.

  

**Required Skills**

* **Deep GCP Knowledge**: Proven expertise in architecting, implementing, and managing GCP infrastructure, including practical experience with services such as AppEngine, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Pub/Sub, and BigQuery.
* **Infrastructure Automation Proficiency**: Skilled in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform to drive efficient and scalable cloud management practices.
* **Monitoring and Observability Experience**: Strong background in using tools like Stackdriver, Prometheus, or Grafana for maintaining system health and visibility.
* **Containerization and Orchestration**: Proficient in containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration to support efficient scaling and resource usage in cloud environments.
* **Scripting and Automation Skills**: Proficiency in scripting languages like Python or Bash, enabling you to create scalable and reusable automation solutions for cloud infrastructure management.
* **Performance Optimization Abilities**: Expertise in troubleshooting and resolving performance issues within cloud infrastructure, ensuring efficient and reliable operations.
* **Incident Management Experience**: Familiarity with incident response practices and a proactive approach to minimizing service interruptions and maintaining uptime.

  

**Preferred Skills**

* **Cost Management and Optimization on GCP**: Experience implementing strategies to control cloud costs, including efficient resource scaling and usage optimization on GCP.
* **CI/CD Workflow Knowledge**: Familiarity with CI/CD practices, enabling product teams to streamline deployments and improve reliability using cloud-native tooling.
* **Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) Principles**: Knowledge of SRE best practices and experience in applying them to improve operational resilience and platform stability.
* **Cloud-Native Development Insights**: Understanding of microservices architectures and the best practices for building, managing, and scaling applications in a cloud-native environment

**Why Join Us**


As a Cloud Platform Engineer at Brite Payments, your work will establish the foundation for high-quality, resilient cloud infrastructure that supports our ambitious growth. You’ll drive GCP best practices, enabling product teams to be self-sufficient while ensuring they have a scalable, reliable, and cost-effective platform to build on. Join us to make a meaningful impact on our cloud platform and be part of an innovative team dedicated to operational excellence across Brite Payments.

**What we offer**

* An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where you can be yourself.
* A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment, with the chance to join one of Europe’s hottest fintechs and learn from industry leaders.
* The opportunity to make an impact from day one in an organisation that values quick decision-making, teamwork, and results over titles.
* Exposure to a variety of verticals and use cases for our payments products, working with some of the fastest-growing businesses in Europe.
* An annual well-being and professional development allowance to invest in your personal growth.
* A team of fun, skilled professionals who together raised the largest Series A ($60m) in Europe last year – join colleagues who are committed to making a lasting impact.

Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.

title: Development Engineer - Virtual Modelling
description:
*At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day.*

*And we need people like you to make it happen.*


***We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.***

  


**Job Summary**
---------------



Modelling & Simulations is a fundamental capability to support innovation and product creation in our food processing and packaging systems, as it involves deep understanding and knowledge of the processes to ensure quality in the development and in the final product.  

  

**In Development &Technology (D&T), Equipment Engineering, we are looking for a Development Engineer specializing in Virtual Modelling.**  

  

In this role you will be part of the Simulation, Modelling and Measurement Team in Preparation & Forming Solutions department. The team supports development projects and technical know-how activities by developing mathematical models and running simulations to enable informed decision-making. We provide advanced simulations and measurements to co-develop (support, drive, validate, and confirm) the designs for the sub-systems within Preparation & Forming Solutions, working in a fully integrated way with stakeholders across different projects and competence areas.  

  

This is a permanent position based in Lund, Sweden.


**What you will do**
--------------------


* Work in project teams to develop simulation models and perform technical calculations using commercial finite element tools, providing insights and relevant information to enable technical decision-making.
* Maintain and develop knowledge in computational mechanics, finite element methods, and material calibration, with a special focus on modelling packaging materials, forming processes, and machine-material interaction.
* Define test specifications, collect data, and analyze results from experimental activities to validate virtual simulations.
**We believe you have**
-----------------------


* A Master’s degree in engineering
* At least 1-2 years of working experience in similar position
* Expertise in solid mechanics and finite element methods at a student level
* Previous experience in finite element modelling and simulation of mechanical systems using commercial software tools (e.g., Dassault Systèmes Abaqus) is preferred
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken

  

  

As a person you have a strong personal drive and structured approach when required to drive activities autonomously, including a very high interest in technical solutions and innovation. You have a flexible, driven, proactive personality with high ability to collaborate and communicate working in groups.  

  

Furthermore, you have good communication and presentation skills and you are structured and have an analytical way of thinking.


**We Offer You**


* A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
* A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
* An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
* Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

  




**Apply Now**


If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.


To find out more about how it is to work at Tetra Pak in Lund, take a look at following website https://publications.inpublix.com/we-are-tetra-pak/

  


**This job posting expires on 2024-11-22.**

  


To know more about the position contact Paolo Sanibondi at +39059898503  

Questions about your application contact Sara Johannesson +46 733 36 2964  

For trade union information contact Sveriges Ingenjörer Lars Haraldsson at +46 46 36 2533 and Unionen Lisbeth Larsson at +46 46 36 2320

  


*Diversity, equity, and inclusion is an everyday part of how we work. We give people a place to belong and support to thrive, an environment where everyone can be comfortable being themselves and has equal opportunities to grow and succeed. We embrace difference, celebrate people for who they are, and for the diversity they bring that helps us better understand and connect with our customers and communities worldwide.*
